main event: Two meteor-like objects of yellowish-red color were sighted passing in front of an aircraft at McClellan AFB on May 4, 1957.
interesting points: The first object passed the aircraft at 10,000 feet, going east to west, while the second object passed the aircraft at 8,000 feet, going west to east.
The objects were described as similar to the afterburner of an F-102 aircraft.
No unknown aircraft were detected by radar in the area at the time of the sightings.
The sightings occurred near a danger area used for gunnery and rocket practice, and crew members speculated the objects may have been rockets.
Two U.S. Navy submarines were known to be operating in the area at the time of the sightings.
sighted object: Two meteor-like objects of yellowish-red color
